intro: Epilobium pubens var. pubens, commonly known as sticky willow or velvetleaf willow, is a flowering plant in the family Onagraceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems covered in fine, sticky hairs. The leaves are opposite, ovate, and often glandular, with a rough texture. It produces small, pink to red flowers in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. This plant is native to parts of Europe and is often found in moist soils along streambanks and woodland edges.
